message_1: What is the balanced equation for the single replacement reaction between magnesium (Mg) and hydrochloric acid (HCl), and what are the products of the reaction?
message_2:
The balanced equation for the single replacement reaction between magnesium (Mg) and hydrochloric acid (HCl) is:

Mg (s) + 2 HCl (aq) → MgCl₂ (aq) + H₂ (g)

The products of the reaction are magnesium chloride (MgCl₂) and hydrogen gas (H₂).
